Dear Friends:
I feel I must comment on the document sent you by the NAEB Radio
Network School Committee, relating to the cost of the Network service*
We do in-school broadcasting only; we are a 20 KW station. Under
these circumstances I feel we are assessed too much for our various NAEB
affiliations* We seem to be penalized for our 20 KW powerl I think that
wattage is an unfair basis for assessment*
As you can see, the general NAEB offerings are very rarely practical
for our operation* Jeffersonian Heritage and American Adventure were all we
used this year—and they were rather adult for classrooms*
We need the in-school programs—although we do not use many, picking
and choosing very carefully* I want Newark to be affiliated with the best
thinking in radio and television in the country—for the cause1 I feel
myself a part of NAEB,
But, our budget just got by this year after plenty of skirmishing*
I wonder just how long I c$n recommend membership when the in-school character
of our operation so limits our use of NAEB offerings.
Let's get off the unfair wattage assessment and stress the element
of usageI
Sincerely yours,
/s/ Marie C* Scanlon
Marie C, Scanlon
Supervisor of Radio and Television
